data.title: 92.7 The Wave Home
data.text:
JOHNNIE BALLENGER, 93, RUSSELL SPRINGS

Johnnie Ballenger, 93, of Russell Springs, KY passed away on June 28th at the VA Hospital in Lexington, KY. Johnnie was born in Jamestown, KY on October 26, 1924 a son of the late Mary Jane (Lawless) and Cellie Ballenger.

He was preceded in death by his parents, wife Marie (Foley) Ballenger, 1 sister Betty Lou Stearns, and 4 brothers Glen, Leonard, Leland and Lindsey Earl Ballenger.

SURVIVORS:

2 daughters Linda (David) Herriford, Marlene (Edward) McClure both of Lexington, KY

2 sisters Alene Pennington, of Dayton, OH; Pauletta Stoyall. of Shepherdsville, KY

1 brother: Gary Ballenger, of Columbia, KY

4 grandchildren

3 great grandchildren

Funeral Service: Sunday, July 1st, 2018 at 2:00pm at H.E. Pruitt Memory Chapel in Jamestown, KY with Bro. Bodie Emerson officiating

Visitation: After 12noon on Sunday at the funeral home

Burial: Camp Nelson National Cemetery in Nicholasville, KY on Monday, July 2, 2018 at 1:30pm ET

BARBARA WEDDLE NORMAN, 66, LIBERTY

Barbara Ann Weddle Norman, 66, of Liberty, KY passed away on Thursday, June 28, 2018 at her home. Born on May 17, 1952 in Liberty, KY, she was a daughter of Eardean and Eula Hatfield Weddle.

Barbara was a dedicated homemaker and caregiver. She also enjoyed baking and sewing.

In addition to her parents, she is also survived by 3 sons: Robert (Sherry) Norman of Liberty, Randy Norman of Liberty and Jeff (Erica) Norman of Greensburg; 7 grandchildren: Spencer, Lindsey, Chelsea, Nic, Devin, Jonathon and Bryan; and 3 great-grandchildren: Owen, Leland and Kate. Other survivors include, 3 brothers and 3 sisters.

Barbara was preceded in death by an infant daughter, Brittany Nicole Norman.

Funeral Service: 2:00 P.M. on Saturday, June 30, 2018 at McKinney-Brown Funeral Home, with Bro. Johnnie Maupin officiating.

Burial: Poplar Springs Cemetery

Visitation: 11:00 A.M. to 2:00 P.M. on Saturday, June 30, 2018 at McKinney-Brown Funeral Home

Memorial contributions may be made to the funeral home to assist the family with funeral expenses.

Arrangements for Ms. Norman are entrusted to McKinney-Brown Funeral Home. An online guestbook is available at www.mckinneybrown.com

MABEL CHUMBLEY MINTON, 94, WINDSOR

Mabel (Chumbley) Minton, 94, of Windsor, KY passed away Thursday, June 28, 2018 at Russell County Hospital in Russell Springs, KY. She was born on Monday February 25, 1924 in Russell County, KY, a daughter of the late Cornelious Chumbley and Cassie Chumbley Stephens.

She was a homemaker and a member of Jennie's Chapel United Methodist Church.

SURVIVORS:

2 Daughters: Janice Roberts and Barbara Joann Condra both of Windsor, KY

1 Son: Dale Minton, Jamestown, KY

Special niece: Polly Rathbun, Windsor, KY

6 grandchildren: Sheila Luttrell, Anthony Roberts, Alan Roberts, Kendra Cape, Kevin Roberts and Ben Lutz

11 great-grandchildren

7 great-great grandchildren

She was preceded in death by her husband, Leslie Minton and a daughter, Opal Minton.

Visitation: Sunday July 1, 2018 from 4:00 PM till 7:00 PM at Wilson Funeral Home Chapel, 391 East Steve

Wariner Drive, Russell Springs, KY

Funeral Service: Monday July 2, 2018 at 10:00amCT at Wilson Funeral Home Chapel with Bro. Shannon Cain officiating

Interment: Jennie's Chapel Cemetery, Merritt Ridge Road, Windsor, KY

MARKILIA RUTH FRANKLIN, 25, COLUMBIA

Markilia Ruth Franklin Gomez, 25, of Columbia, KY died Tuesday, June 19, 2018 at the University of Kentucky Medical in Lexington.

She was preceded in death by her grandparents; Diane Powell, Coy Turner, Sr., William Henry and Bonnie Turner Franklin

SURVIVORS:

Her mother: Carrie Turner Morgan of Columbia

Her father: Mark Franklin and his wife Melissa of Sparksville

4 children: Karissa Mounce, Mary Anna Albarez, Sophia Gomez and Ariel Gomez

2 brothers: Dakota Stotts of Columbia, Timmy Franklin of Russell Springs

1 sister: Alisha Stotts of Columbia

Special uncle and aunt: Coy & Tony Turner of Columbia

Several other aunts, uncles, cousins & friends

A gathering of family and friends will be Tuesday, July 3, 2018 at 6:00 P.M. at the Columbia Christian Church Park

Cremation was chosen by the family

Grissom-Martin Funeral Home in charge of arrangements.

GREGORY LYNN JOHNSON, 55, CENTER

Gregory Lynn Johnson, 55, of Center, KY died Wednesday, June 27, 2018 at his home. He was the son of the late Dee Johnson and Emogene Bowles Greer who survives.

Besides his mother, he is survived by a brother Kenny Johnson of Knob Lick, 2 nieces: Nickie (Steve) Garmon and Suzie Johnson, 2 great nieces: Cienna Garmon and Alexis Bragg.

Besides his father, he was preceded in death by a great nephew: Michael Garmon and his grandparents: Otley & Leora Bowles and Miley & Laura Johnson, 1 sister-in-law: Jeanette Johnson.

Mr. Johnson was a farmer.

Funeral Service: Saturday, June 30, 2018 at 2pmCT at Butler Funeral Home in Edmonton, KY

Burial: Center Cemetery

Visitation: Saturday after 9amCT until service time at the funeral home

Butler Funeral Home in Edmonton, KY in charge of arrangements.

SONA MICHELLE SHAW, 54, CAMPBELLSVILLE

Sona Michelle Shaw, 54, passed away unexpectedly at her home in Campbellsville on Tuesday, June 26, 2018. Born February 23, 1964 to the late Samuel Gabbert and Lyda May (Price) Martin.

She was a homemaker and wife to Mr. Harold Keith Shaw, who preceded her in death. Mrs. Shaw suffered several disabilities in her life, but she lived as independently as possible, both in body and spirit. She professed faith in Christ and attended the Campbellsville Baptist Church when possible.

She was also preceded in death by 6 siblings: Paula Faye Cox, Rita Mae Hafley, Juanita Jo Morgeson, Charlene Brockman, Marlene Bell, and Jessie Samuel Gabbert

SURVIVORS:

3 siblings: Freda Wash of Nicholasville, James Corbin & wife Deborah of Campbellsville, Lloyd David Gabbert of Tennessee

Several nieces & nephews, and other family & friends

Funeral Service: Sunday, July 1, 2018 at 12:00 PM in the chapel of the L.R. Petty Funeral Home, 1765 New Columbia Rd, Campbellsville, KY

Burial: Beside her husband in the Ryder Cemetery, E. Main St, Lebanon, KY

Visitation: Sunday, July 1, 2018 from 10:00 AM until time for the funeral

DON ANTLE, 87, CAMPBELLSVILLE

Don Antle, 87, of Campbellsville, KY, the son of the late Albert Arnett Antle and Virgie Mae Pike Antle, was born May 15, 1931, in Warren County, Kentucky. He died at 8:25 P.M., Wednesday, June 27, 2018 in Campbellsville.

He professed faith in Christ and was a member of Elk Horn Baptist Church where he had served as a deacon. He was a veteran of the Korean Conflict having served his country honorably in the United States Army and was a member of Battery B 623 Field Artillery Battalion. He was also a member of the Elk Horn Masonic Lodge #568 F & AM. Don was a retired employee of Campbellsville Laundry and Kroger. He was an avid fisherman and enjoyed talking about fishing to his friends and family.

He united in marriage to Nadean Barnett April 25, 1953.

Besides his wife, Nadean Antle of Campbellsville, he is survived by two daughters: Donna Antle of Campbellsville and Jeanean Malone and husband, Larry of Buffalo; four grandchildren: Andrea Lawhorn and husband, Phil and Adam Dobson and wife, Rachael of Campbellsville, Andrew Dobson and companion, Meranda Quinn of Knifley and Austin Malone of Buffalo; six great-grandchildren: Chase Lawless, Brianna Dobson, Cayton Lawhorn, Aubri Dobson, Addyson Dobson and Mason Baldwin-Schiess; and many other relatives and friends.

_______________

VISITATION: 5:00-8:00 P.M., Sunday, July 1, 2018 at Elk Horn Baptist Church

FUNERAL SERVICE: 1:00 P.M., Monday, July 2, 2018 at Elk Horn Baptist Church in Campbellsville by Dr. Brian Rafferty, Bro. Eddie Finn & Bro. Haywood Riner

BURIAL: Campbellsville Memorial Gardens with full military honors by the Marion County Veterans Honor Guard

EXPRESSIONS OF SYMPATHY REQUESTED TO BE DONATIONS TO GIDEON BIBLES AND MAY BE MADE AT PARROTT & RAMSEY FUNERAL HOME

GILBERT E. "GIL" BLEVINS, 74, CAMPBELLSVILLE

Gilbert E. “Gil” Blevins, 74, of Campbellsville, KY, the son of Nell Colvin Blevins and the late Edwin Blevins, was born September 29, 1943, in Taylor County, Kentucky. He died at 9:02 A.M., Tuesday, June 26, 2018 while receiving care in the Norton’s Pavilion Hosparus Unit in Louisville.

He professed faith in Christ and was a life-long member of Good Hope Baptist Church. Having done flooring since he was eighteen years old and being the owner of Blevins Tile Flooring, his attention to detail was appreciated by all who used his services. He was an enthusiastic UK fan, an avid golfer and a member of the Campbellsville Country Club since 1965. He was also a devoted husband, loving father and a caring pet owner.

He united in marriage to Laurel Livziey April 2, 1992.

Besides his wife, Laurel Blevins of Campbellsville, he is survived by one son and one daughter: Sherri Hudson and husband, Ashley of Glasgow and Jeff Blevins and wife, Noel of Columbus, Ohio; three step-children: Kelly Donahue of Newington, Connecticut, Trisha Gaier and husband, Greg of Dayton, Ohio and Todd Hartman and wife, Andrea of Bowling Green and ten grandchildren: Natalie Hudson and Sarah Hudson of Glasgow, Aidan Blevins, Claire Blevins and Chloe Blevins of Columbus, Ohio, Rachel Tucker and Patrick Donahue of Newington, Connecticut, McCall Milby and Natalie Gaier of Dayton, Ohio and Lily Hartman of Bowling Green; two great-grandchildren: Landon Motta and Brynn Motta of Newington, Connecticut; his mother, Nell Blevins of Campbellsville, and many other relatives and friends.

_______________

VISITATION: 5:00-8:00 P.M., Sunday, July 1, 2018 at Parrott & Ramsey Funeral Home in Campbellsville and after 10:00 A.M., Monday, July 2, 2018 at Good Hope Baptist Church

FUNERAL SERVICE: 11:00 A.M., Monday, July 2, 2018 at Good Hope Baptist Church in Campbellsville by Rev. J. Alvin Hardy and Rev. Gerald Murphy

BURIAL: Good Hope Baptist Church Cemetery

EXPRESSIONS OF SYMPATHY REQUESTED TO BE DONATIONS TO HOSPARUS OF GREEN RIVER AND MAY BE MADE AT PARROTT & RAMSEY FUNERAL HOME

BECKY ANTLE, 58, JAMESTOWN

Rebecca Kay Antle, 58 of Jamestown, KY passed away Wednesday, June 27, 2018 at 6:10 PM at the Jean Waddle Care Center, Lake Cumberland Regional Hospital in Somerset, KY after a sudden illness. She was born on Feb 6, 1960 in Adair County, KY, the daughter of the late Herman and Marcella Green Duncan.

Rebecca was a member of Griders Chapel United Methodist Church in Russell County, and a custodian at Lindsey Wilson College. She was recently recognized for her 10 years of service at the annual Employee Appreciation and Awards Dinner. Rebecca loved spending time with her family, friends and helping others.

SURVIVORS:

Husband: Donnie Antle of Jamestown, KY

2 sons: Justin Antle & his wife Tiffany of Jamestown, KY; Xander Antle of Jamestown, KY

1 brother: Gary Duncan of Columbia, KY

1 grandson: Brentley Antle

1 Nephew: Veston Duncan

1 niece: Sheena Duncan

Several other relatives & friends

Funeral Service: Saturday June 30, 2018 1:00 P.M. at Stotts-Phelps-McQueary Funeral Home with Rev. Glenn LaFond officiating

Interment: Columbia Cemetery

Visitation: Friday, June 29, 2018 after 4:30pmCT

Pallbearers: Paul Thorpe, Trent Taylor, Jonathan Ford, Gary Bradshaw, Tony Cape, Jack Campbell

Stotts-Phelps-McQueary Funeral Home in charge of funeral arrangements.

IRENE BANKS MOON, 87, GREENSBURG

Irene Banks Moon, 87 of Greensburg, KY passed away Wednesday at the Jane Todd Crawford Hospital in Greensburg.

SURVIVORS:

3 sons and 3 daughters-in-law: Rick & Pamela Moon, Mike & Debrah Moon, and Tracy & Glenda Moon all of Greensburg

1 daughter and a son-in-law: Becky & Terry Martin of Greensburg

11 grandchildren

13 great grandchildren

............................................

Funeral Service: 1:00pmCT, Saturday, June 30, 2018 at Cowherd & Parrott Funeral Home with entombment to follow in the Campbellsville Memorial Gardens Mausoleum

Visitation: 4:00pm until 8 P.M., Friday and after 7:00am Saturday at the Cowherd and Parrott Funeral Home.

Memorials are suggested to be made to the Oneida Baptist Institute, which can be made at the funeral home.

SANDRA JOYCE HART, 67, GEORGETOWN (FORMERLY OF RUSSELL CO.)

Sandra Joyce Hart, 67, of Georgetown (formerly of Russell County) died Tuesday, June 26, 2018 at her home. She was born May 9, 1951 in Somerset, Ky to the late Omra Garland & Frances Cooper Hart.

Sandra was retired from Sate of Kentucky Vocational Rehabilitation.

SURVIVORS:

Husband: Jimmy Boards, Georgetown, Ky

2 Children: Alisha Boards, Christopher Hart

3 Grandchildren: Alivyah Boards, Addisyn Boards, Aiden Hart

2 Sisters: Deloris (Roger) Odenweller, Shelbyville, Ky; Bettye (Donald) Franklin, Russell Springs

1 Brother: Billy Hart, Glasgow, Ky

Celebration of Life Service: 11:00amCT till 12:30pmCT on Saturday, June 30, 2018 at the Bernard Funeral Home Chapel

Interment: New Friendship Cemetery

Bernard Funeral Home in charge af arrangements.

CLYDE WESLEY, 73, HARRODSBURG

Clyde Wesley, 73, of Harrodsburg, KY passed away on Wednesday, June 27, 2018. He was born in Liberty, KY on November 25th,1944 a son of the late Leslie Herbert Wesley and Madeline Lee Wesley.

Clyde was a former Police Officer with the Liberty Police Department and the Casey County Sheriffs Department and a member of Fellowship Baptist Church.

Survivors: His Spouse: Esther Mae Sheldon Wesley, One Son: Clyde Leslie “Les” Paul and (Johnnie) Wesley of Shelbyville, KY One Step Son: Bill and (Rose) Sheldon of Elkhart, IN, Six Grandchildren, Five Great Grandchildren and One Sister: Ivadean Abbott of Cincinnati, OH.

Preceding him in death besides his parents was Four Brothers: Skyler, Herbert Jr., James and Willard Wesley and Five Sisters: Ocie Wesley, Pauline Atwood, Opal Potinsky, Christine Myers and Nancy Taylor.

Visitation: 12:00 Noon Friday, June 29, 2018 at Bartle Funeral Home Chapel

Funeral Service: 2:00 P.M. Friday, June 29, 2018 at Bartle Funeral Home Chapel with Bro. Kenneth Meredith officiating

Burial: Poplar Grove Cemetery

REBECCA "BECKY" BROWN, 62, CAMPBELLSVILLE

Rebecca “Becky” Brown, 62, of Campbellsville, KY passed from this life on Tuesday, June 26, 2018 at the University of Louisville Hospital as the result of an automobile accident. She was born to the late Coakley D. and Vernie Mae (Williams) Seaborne on July 16, 1955.

Ms. Brown had made a profession of faith in Christ and was of the Christian faith. She retired as a food service professional from Pioneer Catering at Campbellsville University and was currently employed as a bus monitor for the Taylor County School District. She loved her family, and in her free time, enjoyed socializing with friends and family and was an avid fan of the University of Kentucky basketball team.

SURVIVORS:

1 son: Richard “Bubby” Brown, Jr. and wife Myra of Greensburg

1 daughter: Dana Cox Welch and husband Joseph Michael Cox of Campbellsville

A chosen family: Tonya and Clint McDonald and their children of Mississippi

5 siblings: Mitchell Clayton Seaborne and wife Maureen of Mannsville, Phyllis Fennell and husband Roland of Mt. Washington, Norman L. Seaborne of Campbellsville, Coakley Seaborne, Jr. and wife Rita of Elk Horn, and Phillip Clay Seaborne and companion Sandy of Campbellsville

8 grandchildren: Jacob Scott Welch, Joshua Seth Welch, Lyrik Marr and husband Landon, Micahla Sears, Jayla Sears, Caselynn Brown, Remy Brown, and Ryan Sears

2 great-grandchildren: Daxton Sears and Rhylee Riggs

Special friends: Kim Fitzgerald and Julie Franklin

A host of nieces, nephews, cousins, and other family and friends

Funeral Service: Friday, June 29, 2018 at 12:00 PM in the chapel of the L.R. Petty Funeral Home and Cremation Service, 1765 New Columbia Rd, Campbellsville, KY with Bro. Travis Bright officiating

Visitation: The family will receive friends at the funeral home on Thursday, June 28, from 5:00-8:00 PM

ELVIA JEAN BOGUES, 84, CAMPBELLSVILLE

Elvia Jean Bogues, 84, of Campbellsville, KY passed from this life on Monday, June 25, 2018 at the Green Hill Nursing and Rehabilitation Center in Greensburg. She was born in Columbia, KY to the late Hobert and Hyacinth (Rigney) Pyles on February 11, 1934. After the untimely death of her mother, Mrs. Bogues was loved and raised by her grandparents, James B. and Retta Mae Pyles.

She was a veteran of the United States Navy, having served her country honorably during the Korean Conflict. She was a loyal, generous, and loving woman, and rightfully proud of her service to her country, her family, and her God. Mrs. Bogues had made a profession of faith in Christ and was a member of the Campbellsville Church of the Nazarene and American Legion.

SURVIVORS:

1 son: Jim Bogues and wife Tonya of Campbellsville

1 grandson: Marshall Bogues, III of Elizabethtown

1 brother: Hobert “Sonny” Pyles of Danville

1 sister: Doris Pyles Casey of Indiana

Special cousins and friends: Debbie Benningfield, Gerry Cunitz, Margaret Pyles, Carol Sue Bohannon, and Shelia Bryant

A host of other close cousins, nieces, nephews, and other family and friends

She was also preceded in death by her husband, Marshall James Bogues in 1977; two sisters, Margie Pyles Johnson and Mary Pyles Smith; five aunts, Claris Pyles, Bonnie Pyles, Altha Pyles, Clara Pyles, and Lyla Pyles; and nine uncles, Finis Pyles, Vitis Pyles, Rollin Pyles, Kenneth Pyles, Robert Pyles, Aaron Pyles, Walter Pyles, James Pyles, and Howard Pyles.

Funeral Service: Saturday, June 30, 2018 at 11:00 AM EST (10:00 AM CST) in the chapel of the L.R. Petty Funeral Home, 1765 New Columbia Rd, Campbellsville, KY

Burial: Brookside Cemetery, W. Main St, Campbellsville, KY

Visitation: The family will receive friends at the funeral home on Friday, June 29, from 5:00-8:00 PM EST (4:00-7:00 PM CST).

REBECCA JEAN BROCK, 61, ADAIR COUNTY

Rebecca Jean (Roberts) Brock, 61, of the Milltown community, died Wednesday, June 27, 2018 at her home. She was born August 18, 1956, in Taylor County, to Tina Browning Roberts and the late Richard Roberts.

She was preceded in death by her father-in-law and mother-in-law, Clarence and Esther Brock and her beloved husband, Tom Brock on October 11, 2017.

Jean was a member of Solid Rock Church, a former hairdresser, sewing machine operator, bus driver, dairy farmer and currently employed by the Adair County Board of Education as a Baker/Cook.

SURVIVORS:

1 daughter and son-in-law: Jennifer and Anand Varahala of Morrisville, NC

1 granddaughter: Aarini Brock Varahala

Mother: Tina Roberts of Columbia

2 brothers: Steve (Tracey) Roberts of Glasgow, James (Marsha) Roberts of Columbia

2 Brothers-in-law: James (Kay) Brock of Bowling Green, Ralph (Dean) Brock of Campbellsville

4 Sisters-in-law: Sheila (Jerry) Kinslow of Glasgow, Shirley (Buddy) Stilts, Doris (Barney) Janes, Darlene (Robert) Baker all of Milltown

Special friends: Pastor Wayne and Jean Keith of Russell Springs

Several nieces, nephews, other relatives & friends

Funeral Service: Friday, June 29, 2018 at 11:00 A.M. at Solid Rock Church in Russell Springs with Pastor Wayne Keith officiating

Burial: Haven Hill Cemetery

Visitation: Thursday, June 28, 2018 from 4:30-9:00 P.M. and after 8:00 A.M. Friday June 29, 2018 at Solid Rock Church

Casket Bearers: Steve Roberts, James Roberts, Anand Varahala, Daniel Smith, Jason Stilts, Jameson Roberts, Steve Roberts II, Bart Roberts

Honorary: Michael Janes, John Janes, Ryan Meadows

Grissom-Martin Funeral Home in charge of arrangements.

BILLY DEAN HUMBLE, 76, LOUISVILLE (FORMERLY OF RUSSELL CO.)

Billy Dean Humble, 76, of Louisville (formerly of Russell County) died Monday June 25, 2018 at the home of his son. He was born September 21, 1941 in Russell County to the late John Elliot & Vonnie Lee Popplewell Humble.

Billy was a factory worker.

In addition to his parents, he was preceded in death by his wife, Joann Foley Humble; 4 siblings, Bland Humble, James Humble, Nannie Brockman, and Eudora Cooper.

SURVIVORS:

1 son: Michael Humble, Elizabethtown, KY

2 grandchildren: Zachary Humble, Grant Humble

2 brothers: Calvin (Janet) Humble, Russell Springs; Avery Humble, Louisville

1 sister: Margaret (Randy) Gosser, Indianapolis, IN

Funeral Service: Monday, July 2, 2018 at 10:00amCT at Poplar Grove Baptist Church with Bro. Danny Haynes officiating.

Visitation: Sunday, July 1, 2018 from 5-8pmCT at Bernard Funeral Home and after 8amCT Monday at the church.

Interment: Poplar Grove Cemetery

Bernard Funeral Home in charge of arrangements.

JOYCE COE, 79, JAMESTOWN

Joyce Coe,79, of Jamestown, KY passed away on Sunday June 24th at her home. She was born in Jamestown, KY on August 20, 1938 a daughter of the late Edna (Gaskin) and Hiram Bernard.

She is preceded in death by her parents, husband John Coe, Jr, 2 sisters Nilla Bernard, Millie Knight and 2 brothers Billy and George Bernard.

SURVIVORS:

3 sons: Boyd (Liz) Coe, of Corbin, KY; Barry (Linda) Coe, of Ooltewah, TN; Vincent Coe, of Jamestown, KY

2 daughters: Belinda (Rick) Antle, of Russell Springs, KY; Bridget (Danny Joe) Emerson, of Russell Springs, KY

3 sisters: Polly Pickett, of Jamestown, KY; Vivian Jordan, of CA; Rhonda Jeffus, of FL

7 grandchildren

7 great grandchildren

Funeral Service: Wednesday June 27th at 11:00am at H.E. Pruitt Memory Chapel, in Jamestown, KY with Pastor Fred Calkins officiating

Visitation: Friends may visit on Tuesday after 5:00pm at the funeral home

Burial: Knight Cemetery

SANDY CLAYTON DEAN, 61, JAMESTOWN

Sandy Clayton Dean, 61, of Jamestown, KY passed away suddenly on June 25, 2018 at her home. Sandy was born in Albany, KY on June 26, 1956 a daughter of the late Wendell Clayton and Wanda (McWhorter) Clayton of Jamestown, KY.

She is preceded in death by her father.

SURVIVORS:

Mother Wanda Clayton, of Jamestown, KY

2 daughters: Heather (Mark) Rooks, of Somerset, KY; Ashley (Kevin) Helm, of Russell Springs, KY

1 sister: Tammy (James) Maynard, of Middleburg, KY

Special cousin: Debra Johnson Lawless, of Jamestown, KY

7 grandchildren

Funeral Service: Thursday June 28th, 11:00am at H.E. Pruitt Memory Chapel in Jamestown, KY on with Pastor Nick Armstrong officiating

Visitation: Friends may visit on Wednesday after 5:00pmET at the funeral home

Burial: Jamestown City Cemetery

BOBBY PHILLIPS, 76, MAGNOLIA

Bobby Phillips, 76, of Magnolia, KY, a son of the late Hugh Leonard Phillips and Rebecca Wilson Phillips, was born August 15, 1941, in Peoria, Illinois. He died at 7:28 A.M., Saturday, June 23, 2018 in Elizabethtown.

Bobby professed faith in Christ and was a member of Mt. Moriah Baptist Church in Magnolia.

He was a retired employee of Phillip Morris and was a former Freemason. Bobby was a big hearted man and his faithful giving to St. Jude Children’s Hospital proved just that. After moving from Louisville he enjoyed collecting Henry firearms mostly in .22 calibers, looking at old cars and loved Bald Eagles. Most of all Bobby loved his family especially his wife, Rachel.

He united in marriage to Rachel Harris March 7, 1964 and she preceded him in death April 20, 2013.

SURVIVORS: 1 daughter, Mary Lois Garr of Magnolia; 2 granddaughters: Rebecca Ann Chancellor and husband, Criss of Lexington and MaryLynn Louise Garr of Magnolia; 1 great-grandson, Thomas James Choate of Lexington; 1 brother and 1 sister: Rollin Phillips of Louisville and Brenda Siegrist of Holiday, Florida; several nieces and nephews and many other relatives and friends.

He was also preceded in death by one granddaughter, Rachel Luriee Kays; three brothers and one sister: William Edward Phillips, Wayne R. Phillips and Charles Phillips and Nellie Jane Phillips in infancy.

VISITATION: 5:00 - 8:00 P.M., Monday, June 25, 2018 at Parrott & Ramsey Funeral Home

FUNERAL SERVICE: 1:00 P.M., Tuesday, June 26, 2018 at Parrott & Ramsey Funeral Home by Rev. Shannon McCubbins

BURIAL: Campbellsville Memorial Gardens

EXPRESSIONS OF SYMPATHY REQUESTED TO BE DONATIONS TO ST. JUDE CHILDREN’S HOSPITAL AND MAY BE MADE AT PARROTT & RAMSEY FUNERAL HOME

EDWIN LAWLESS, 94, RUSSELL SPRINGS

Edwin Lawless, 94, of Russell Springs, died Monday, June 25, 2018 at his home. He was born April 16, 1924 in Russell County to the late Erastus & Myrtie Garner Lawless.

Edwin was a Veteran of US Navy and a member of Russell Springs United Methodist Church. He established Lawless Welding and Lawless & Smith True Value Hardware.

In addition to his parents, he was preceded in death by his wife, Nellie McKinley Lawless; 5 brothers, Omri, Avery, Marshall, R.J. and Herlan Lawless; 3 sisters, Margie Coffey, Geneva Blair and Floy Jean Lawless.

SURVIVORS:

3 daughters: Bobbye (Russell) Butler, Connie (Gene) Smith, Tracy (Mitchell) Richards, all of Russell Springs

8 grandchildren

18 great grandchildren

Funeral Service: Thursday, June 28, 2018 at 2pmCT the Bernard Funeral Home Chapel with Dr. Mark B. Hale & Dr. Timo Karvonen officiating

Visitation: Thursday from 10am-2pmCT

Interment: Mill Springs National Cemetery on Friday, June 29, 2018 at 12:30pm

Special Music: Dean & Sheila McKinley, Ann Blakey

Pallbearers: Dennis Kiser, Chris Butler, Trevor Smith, Dr. Brent Cherry, John Dando, Jason Redmon, Alex Richards, Drew Richards

Bernard Funeral Home in charger of arrangements

DELMER R. CONNER, 93, JAMESTOWN

Delmer R. Conner, 93, of Jamestown, KY passed away on Sunday, June 24, 2018 at the Russell County Hospital. He was born in Jamestown, KY on March 10, 1925 a son of the late Ellen (Higgenbotham) and Dallas Conner.

SURVIVORS:

1 son: Gwinn (Joyce) Conner, of Jamestown, KY

1 daughter: Judy Conner, of Jamestown, KY

3 grandchildren

6 great grandchildren

He is preceded in death by his parents, wife Jewell Pierce Conner, five sisters Sytha Bell,Pearl Brumley, Callie Polston, Audrey Bell and Bessie Bell, three brothers Harlen, Elmer, and Wilburn Conner.

Funeral Services for Delmer Conner are at H.E. Pruitt Memory Chapel in Jamestown, KY on Tuesday, June 26th, 11:00am with Bro. John Blakey officiating.

Friends may visit on Monday after 5:00pm at the funeral home.

Burial in the Dixon Cemetery.

GERALDINE PATTON ASBERRY, 72, DUNNVILLE

Geraldine Patton Asberry, 72, of Dunnville, KY passed away on Friday, June 22, 2018, at Ephraim McDowell Regional Medical Center in Danville. Born on October 16, 1945, in Dunnville, KY, she was a daughter of the late John Welby and Maxine Sallee Patton.

Geraldine was a homemaker. She was a founding member of Goose Creek Baptist Church. She was a loving mother and grandmother that loved to play card games and fish.

She is survived by her husband, Emmett Asberry, who she married on September 26, 1979; three daughters, Sherry (Anthony Roberts) Propes of Liberty, Shirley (Stewart) Carlton of Madison, Alabama and Susan (Gordan) Wilkerson of Dunnville; two sons, Billy (Brandy) Hewitt of Gradyville and Johnny (Misty) Asberry of Dunnville; and a special daughter, Kimberly Hope Salyers of Dunnville. Other survivors include two sisters, Merilene Coffman of Liberty and Imogene Hiter of Athens, Alabama; three brothers, Johnny Patton of Dunnville, Donald Patton of Columbia and James Patton of Liberty; eleven grandchildren; and fourteen great-grandchildren.

Funeral Service: 11:00 A.M. on Wednesday, June 27, 2018, at McKinney-Brown Funeral Home with Bro. Billy Hewitt and Bro. Danny Yaden officiating. Burial will follow in Cold Springs Cemetery.

The family will receive friends from 6:00 P.M. to 9:00 P.M. on Tuesday, June 26, 2018, at McKinney-Brown Funeral Home.

In lieu of flowers, contributions of sympathy may be made to the funeral home to assist the family of Ms. Asberry with funeral expenses.

Geraldine’s pallbearers will be Derek Propes, Steven Inscho, Cory Hewitt, Dustin Carlton, Christopher Patton, Josh Wilkerson, OC Roark, David Asberry. Honorary pallbearers will be Kameron Cox, Daveia Inscho, Jade Brown and Eyan Propes.

Arrangements are entrusted to McKinney-Brown Funeral Home. An online guestbook is available at www.mckinneybrown.com.

ANTHONY 'POPS' YORK, 97, LIBERTY

Anthony “Pops” York, age 97, passed away on Saturday, June 23, 2018, surrounded by his loving family at the Casey County Hospital in Liberty.

Born on August 20, 1920, in Casey County, Kentucky, he was a son of the late Ethel Monroe York and Effie Austin York.

Mr. York was a devoted and faithful member, usher, and a member of the building and grounds committee at First Baptist Church of Liberty since 1953. He could be seen handing out church programs every Sunday morning at First Baptist.

Throughout his lifetime, Mr. York worked at a service station, feed store, car lot, farmed, and operated a grocery store and gas station. He also worked at King’s Department Store and managed Baldwin’s Men’s Store and Casey Dry Goods, which later became the Dollar General, which was the second Dollar General store in the chain. For his 90th birthday, Mr. York was gifted a self-propelled push mower, and could frequently be seen mowing his, as well his family’s yards, as well as the grounds at Brush Creek Cemetery. In 2013, he was presented with a well-deserved Lifetime Achievement Award.

Survivors include his son, Tony (Katie) York of Liberty; daughter, Clydia (David) King of Liberty; seven grandchildren, Brad (Nicky) King, Brian (Angela) King, Barry (Amy) King, Andy Jackson, Ryan (Emma) Jackson, Emilee (David) York Kimbler and Ashley (Josh) York Burchett; ten great-grandchildren, Leann, Jenna, Adam, Jackson, Ava, Asher, Archer, Mason, Kinslee and Avery; and a great-great grandchild, Bailey. Other survivors include two sisters, Lula Bell (Bob) Lawson of Cincinnati, OH and Charlotte (John Livingston) Amburgy of Murfreesboro, TN; and two brothers, Frankie (Dorcas) York of Cincinnati, OH and Michael (Karen) York of Arizona.

In addition to his parents, Mr. York is preceded in death by his loving wife, Vodella Thomas York, who passed away on May 23, 2007; a sister, Uva Dell Hoskins; and a brother, Archie York.

The funeral service will be held at 1:00 P.M. on Tuesday, June 26, 2018, at First Baptist Church of Liberty with Bro. Brad King, Bro. Jimmy Brown and Bro. Joe Hatchett officiating. Burial will follow in Wilkerson Cemetery.

The family of Mr. York will receive friends from 6:00 P.M. to 8:00 P.M. on Monday, June 25, 2018 and from 8:00 A.M. to 1:00 P.M. on Tuesday, June 26, 2018, at First Baptist Church of Liberty.

In lieu of flowers, contributions of sympathy may be made to the First Baptist Church of Liberty Window Fund or to the Gideons International.

JAMES A "JIM" HATCHER, 73, CAMPBELLSVILLE

James A. “Jim” Hatcher, 73, of Campbellsville, KY, the son of the late Herbert W. Hatcher and Laura Raymer Hatcher, was born March 3, 1945 in Jefferson County, KY. He died at 5:51pmET on Saturday, June 16, 2018 in Elizabethtown, KY.
